description: From Latin veridicus (“truly said”), from verus (“true”) and dīcō (“I say”).

adjectives.description: veridical (comparative more veridical, superlative most veridical)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to an experience, perception, or interpretation that accurately represents reality; as opposed to imaginative, unsubstantiated, illusory, or delusory.
examples: Few believe that all claimed religious experiences are veridical.
